content.question: According to the data, which of the following best explains the results of the experiment?

choices.label: The <math alttext="p H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of the treatment culture was lower than the <math alttext="p H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of the control because the chemical increased the bacterial metabolic rate.

The <math alttext="p H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of the treatment culture was higher than the <math alttext="p H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of the control because the chemical denatured bacterial enzymes and decreased the metabolic rate.
The chemical increased the metabolic rate of the bacteria because it lowered the <math alttext="p H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.
The chemical decreased the metabolic rate of the bacteria because it bound all available oxygen.

content.answer: The <math alttext="p H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of the treatment culture was lower than the <math alttext="p H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of the control because the chemical increased the bacterial metabolic rate.

skill.text: 2.B: Explain relationships between characteristics of biological models in both theoretical and applied contexts.
